search_init_recipe.title: Search Init - Initiating the Search Sequence in the Hotel API
search_init_recipe.description: This initial call initiates the search sequence in the hotel API. It returns a token that will be used throughout the entire process from search to booking.
search_init_recipe.purpose: Initialize hotel search and obtain a token for the complete booking workflow
required_criteria: currency - Three-letter currency code (USD, EUR, etc.)
checkIn - Check-in date in ISO format
checkOut - Check-out date in ISO format
occupancy details - Number of adults and child ages per room

search_types.circular_region: Search within a radius from a center point
search_types.polygon: Search within a defined polygon area using coordinates
search_types.hotel_ids: Search specific hotels by their IDs

mandatory_headers.description: The following headers are mandatory for all API calls from search to booking
headers: correlationId - Must remain the same throughout the search to booking process

channelId.description: Your channel identifier for this search

segmentId.description: Optional segment identifier for rate filtering

currency.description: Three-letter currency code (USD, EUR, GBP, etc.)

culture.description: Culture code for localization (en-us, fr-fr, etc.)

occupancies.description: Room occupancy details - one object per room

items.numOfAdults: Number of adults in this room
items.childAges: Array of child ages in this room

polygonalRegion.description: Search within a polygon area defined by coordinates

hotelIds.description: Array of specific hotel IDs to search

countryOfResidence.description: Guest country of residence (two-letter country code)

token.description: Unique search token to be used in all subsequent API calls

search_init_recipe.curl_example:
curl --location --request POST 'https://nexus.prod.zentrumhub.com/api/hotel/availability/init' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8' \
--header 'Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate' \
--header 'accountId: zentrum-demo-account' \
--header 'customer-ip: 49.43.4.237' \
--header 'correlationId: a8e78ad3-cc6c-2fa8-02c1-545adec2e51f' \
--header 'apiKey: 4477a62d-2bb6-4392-896a-3f5270962dbc' \
--data-raw '{"channelId": "demo-channel", "currency": "USD", "checkIn": "2024-12-04T00:00:00", "checkOut": "2024-12-05T00:00:00", "occupancies": [{"numOfAdults": 2, "childAges": []}], "polygonalRegion": {"coordinates": [{"lat": 18.3081, "long": 73.431717}]}}'
key_points: The token returned is used throughout the entire search to booking process
CorrelationId must remain the same from search to booking for proper tracking
You can search by different geographical methods (circular, polygon, multi-polygon) or specific hotel IDs
All required search criteria must be provided in the initial call
Only one search type should be specified per request (circularRegion OR polygonalRegion OR hotelIds, etc.)
The occupancies array supports multi-room searches with different occupancy per room
workflow_integration: 1. Call Search Init API with search criteria to get token
2. Use token in Search Results API to get hotel availability
3. Use same token in RoomsAndRates API for detailed room information
4. Use same token in Price API for rate validation
5. Use same token in Book API for final reservation
6. Maintain same correlationId throughout entire workflow
important_notes: The token has a limited lifespan - complete the booking workflow promptly
All geographical coordinates should be in decimal degrees format
For polygon searches, ensure coordinates form a closed polygon
Child ages are required for accurate pricing - empty array if no children
Currency affects both search results and final pricing

search_results_polling_recipe.title: Search Results Polling
search_results_polling_recipe.description: Progressive polling mechanism to retrieve search results as they become available from multiple suppliers. Use this when search results are still being compiled.
search_results_polling_recipe.purpose: Retrieve additional search results using polling mechanism when initial search status is 'InProgress'

polling_mechanism.description: After initiating the search request with the provided token, the response may include one of the following statuses

Completed.description: Indicates that the full set of search results is available
Completed.action: Stop polling - all results have been retrieved

InProgress.description: Indicates that the search results are still being compiled
InProgress.action: Continue polling using the nextResultsKey parameter
InProgress.includes: Response will include a nextResultsKey parameter for subsequent requests

polling_process: 4. Make subsequent request with nextResultsKey parameter
5. Repeat until status is 'Completed' or 10 seconds elapsed
required_headers: correlationId: Same correlation ID from search init
search_results_polling_recipe.curl_example:
curl --location --request GET 'https://nexus.prod.zentrumhub.com/api/hotel/availability/async/9bdd5776-cc46-4046-ac30-b3a428376bea/results?nextResultsKey=MF81NTM=' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8' \
--header 'Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate' \
--header 'accountId: zentrum-demo-account' \
--header 'customer-ip: 49.43.4.237' \
--header 'correlationId: d2ca03b0-f5a4-ce7b-0642-3d7c961573e7' \
--header 'apiKey: 4477a62d-2bb6-4392-896a-3f5270962dbc'

token.description: The search token from init call

expectedHotelCount.description: Total number of hotels expected in results

completedHotelCount.description: Number of hotels processed so far

hotels.description: Array of hotel results with rates and details

nextResultsKey.description: Key for next polling request (only present when status is InProgress)

real_world_polling_example.scenario: Saudi Arabia hotel search with negotiated rates

negotiated_rates_example.description: Example showing negotiated rates with different characteristics
features: Base rate equals total rate (no additional taxes/fees)
Negotiated rate type instead of Published
PAN mandatory for Indian tax compliance

cancellation_policy_structure.description: Detailed cancellation rules with time-based penalties

meal_plan_options.roomOnly: Room accommodation only, no meals included
meal_plan_options.halfBoard: Room with breakfast and one main meal (lunch or dinner)
meal_plan_options.fullBoard: Room with all three meals (breakfast, lunch, dinner)
meal_plan_options.allInclusive: Room with all meals, drinks, and activities included

isGstMandatory.description: Whether GST information is required for booking

isPANMandatory.description: Whether PAN (Permanent Account Number) is required for booking
isPANMandatory.note: Common requirement for Indian market bookings

implementation_guidelines: Always check response status before proceeding
Implement proper polling intervals (500ms) to avoid rate limiting
Set maximum polling duration (10 seconds) to prevent infinite loops
Handle both InProgress and Completed statuses appropriately
Store and use nextResultsKey for subsequent polling requests
Maintain same headers across all polling requests
Process incremental results as they arrive for better UX
workflow_integration: 1. Call Search Init API to get token
2. Call Search Results API with token
3. If status is 'InProgress', start polling with nextResultsKey
4. Continue polling until status is 'Completed' or timeout
5. Proceed to RoomsAndRates API with selected hotel
6. Continue with booking workflow
key_differences_from_basic_search: Uses nextResultsKey parameter for progressive loading
Results arrive incrementally from different suppliers
Better for handling large result sets
Allows early display of partial results
search_results_polling_recipe.next_step: After retrieving the desired results set, the next step in the process is RoomsAndRates API call

roomsandrates_recipe.title: RoomsAndRates API
roomsandrates_recipe.description: This API call retrieves detailed room and rate specifications for all available rooms in a hotel selected from the search results. Uses the selected hotelId and token obtained from the search results call.

recommendations_explanation.purpose: Useful for multi-room booking scenarios. A recommendation is a combination of rates created based on common booking patterns.
recommendations_explanation.why_needed: Some suppliers return rates for individual rooms, others return rates for entire booking as single package. API abstracts this complexity by creating recommendations so all rates can be perceived as rates for the entire booking.

rate_combinability_recipe.title: ZentrumHub Rate Combinability
rate_combinability_recipe.description: Understanding how to group rates by RateCombinabilityType for multi-room bookings and rate combinations. The Rate object consists of RateCombinabilityId and RateCombinabilityType fields that define rate grouping rules.
rate_combinability_recipe.purpose: Enable proper rate combination logic for multi-room bookings and package deals

rateCombinabilityId.description: GUID assigned to the rate for grouping purposes

rateCombinabilityType.description: Defines the grouping behavior of rates

None.description: Rate cannot be combined with any other rates
None.usage: Standalone rates that must be booked individually
None.example: Special promotional rates or exclusive packages

GroupDifferentId.description: Rate can be combined with rates having different RateCombinabilityId values
GroupDifferentId.usage: Rates that can mix and match with other rate types
GroupDifferentId.example: Standard rates that can combine with different room types

GroupWithinSameId.description: Rate can only be combined with other rates having the same RateCombinabilityId
GroupWithinSameId.usage: Package rates or group rates that must stay together
GroupWithinSameId.example: Conference packages or group booking rates

GroupSameId.description: Rate must be combined with other rates having the same RateCombinabilityId
GroupSameId.usage: Mandatory package components that require other parts

rate_11.meaning: Cannot combine with other rates - book independently

rate_13_21.meaning: Must be booked together as a package

rate_23_24_14.meaning: Can combine only with same ID (111)

implementation_logic.step_1: Parse all rates and group by rateCombinabilityType
implementation_logic.step_2: For 'None' type rates - present as individual options

GroupSameId.usage: Package rates that must be booked together
GroupSameId.example: Conference packages where all rooms must be from same package

GroupDifferentId.description: Rate can be combined with other GroupDifferentId rates regardless of rateCombinabilityId
GroupDifferentId.example: Different room types or rate plans that can be combined

GroupWithinSameId.description: Rates can only be combined with other rates having the same rateCombinabilityId
GroupWithinSameId.usage: Package rates that must stay within same group
GroupWithinSameId.example: Conference packages where all rooms must be from same package

implementation_logic: Parse rates and group by rateCombinabilityType
For 'None' type - present as individual options only
For 'GroupDifferentId' - allow mixing with other GroupDifferentId rates
For 'GroupWithinSameId' - restrict to same rateCombinabilityId only
validation_rules: Rates with 'None' type cannot be combined with any other rates
Rates with 'GroupSameId' must include all rates with same rateCombinabilityId
Rates with 'GroupDifferentId' can combine regardless of rateCombinabilityId
Rates with 'GroupWithinSameId' can only combine with identical rateCombinabilityId
